summary: This FBI Situational Report details the status of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) and the ongoing sex trafficking investigation on his private island, Little St. James, as of August 13, 2019. It outlines investigative plans, provides a timeline of events leading to Epstein's death, and notes irregularities including falsified prison logs.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the death investigation; was found dead in his cell at the MCC on August 10, 2019, after a prior suicide attempt on July 23, 2019.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: Epstein's cell mate at the MCC who was released on the morning of August 9, 2019, leaving Epstein alone in his cell.

connections.description: Were cell mates at the Metropolitan Correctional Center until Reyes was released on August 9, 2019.

events.title: Epstein Remanded to MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was remanded to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.

events.title: Epstein Placed on Suicide Watch
events.description: Epstein was placed on suicide watch and evaluated by an MCC Psychologist.

events.title: Epstein's First Suicide Attempt
events.description: Epstein first attempted suicide via hanging and was discovered unconscious in his cell at approximately 1:27 a.m. EDT.

events.title: Cell Mate Released; Unmonitored Phone Call
events.description: Epstein's cell mate, Efrain Reyes, was released. Later that evening, an MCC Correctional Officer allowed Epstein to make a 20-minute phone call on an unsecured, unmonitored line.

events.title: Epstein Found Dead
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his jail cell with a makeshift noose around his neck. He was pronounced dead after unsuccessful revival efforts.

events.title: Falsified Prison Logs Discovered
events.description: Initial incident reports documented that two MCC Correctional Officers falsified observation logs for Epstein's cell for the overnight hours of August 9-10, prompting a criminal investigation by the OIG.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, NY
keyFacts: Two MCC Correctional Officers falsified observation logs for Epstein's cell for the night of August 9-10, 2019, leading to a criminal investigation by the Office of Inspector General (OIG).
Epstein was allowed to make a 20-minute phone call on an unsecured and unmonitored line on the evening of August 9, 2019, shortly before his death.
Epstein's cell mate, Efrain Reyes, was released on the morning of August 9, 2019, leaving Epstein alone in his cell.
The FBI was seeking surveillance video from the MCC dating back to at least Epstein's first suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, a process expected to take up to eight days.

Investigators planned to interview 14 individuals connected to Epstein's private island, Little St. James, including an IT specialist, property manager, housekeeper, and an air traffic control witness identified via a USMS travel documentation investigation.
